nodes.message: Doing this here instead of reset day to reduce on scripting redundance (28 versions of the logic below...)

nodes.text: Looks like a pretty basic lock - probably a Hardy class.
Looks like a pretty basic lock.
There's nothing more I can learn from practicing on this simple a lock.
Hmmm... it's a lock, all right.
This is more complicated than just a basic lock.
Looks like an L-Bow class - sophisticated and devious.
There's nothing more I can learn from practicing on this simple a lock.
Hmmm... it's a lock, all right.
Tricky - this lock is a Marple Class now.
I've mastered this now. There's nothing more I can learn from practicing on this simple a lock.
This is a more advanced type of lock. It will take a Houdini to open it.
The only thing I can tell about this lock is that it will take a Houdini 42 to open it.
This lock is a Wolfe Class.
This is a more advanced type of lock. It will take a Houdini to open it.
The only thing I can tell about this lock is that it will take a Houdini 42 to open it.
This isn't the same basic lock; Master von Urwald must have changed it.
Looks like it is a Hardy class - just a little tricker than the basic lock.
The only thing I can tell about this lock is that it's not just a basic design.
This lock is a Marlowe class.
It's about as tough a lock as they come.
The only thing I can tell about this lock is that it will take a Houdini 42 to open it.
Any of these lockers could be trapped now, though. I should check it extra carefully...
Aha! A Trap, you dastardly locker you.
Nothing amiss here. This locker is completely trap-free.
I can't tell if anything is wrong with the locker or not.
Ack! I guess it was!
I wouldn't know a trap if it bit me.
If only I had a Trap Tapper to disarm this with... I really do need to get one.
Solved it!
Ouch! I messed up. At least this wasn't a real trap that could seriously hurt me.
This one is tricky... gotta focus!
This is exhausting. I've been staring at locks for much too long. I'm starting to cramp up. That's enough for today.
Ack! This locker needs a Houdini to open it.
I guess I need to get one.
It's getting too close to suppertime to practice right now.
It's getting late... This is too dull to do this now. I'll probably just fall asleep at it.
Easy... easy... there.
Just a little touch and a gentle twist...
Grrrr... stupid lock.
My knees are getting tired.
All it takes is a light touch.
This one seems trickier than most...
I think I'm getting this!
